title: Supplements and Safety
description: An investigation into the hidden dangers of vitamins and supplements, with The New York Times and the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation.

January 19, 2016 Featured Documentaries Related [Can Regulators Keep Up with the Supplements Industry?](https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/article/can-regulators-keep-up-with-the-supplements-industry/) The health supplements industry has grown into a more than $30 billion industry, but it has come under scrutiny in recent years for many of the wrong reasons. January 19, 2016 [Five Questions To Ask When Considering Health Supplements](https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/article/five-questions-to-ask-when-considering-health-supplements/) While there are no guarantees about what's actually in a supplement, there are steps consumers can take to avoid misleading or even harmful products. January 19, 2016 [How Beneficial is Fish Oil?](https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/video/how-beneficial-is-fish-oil/) Fish oil is the third most widely used supplement in the United States. But there can be a big difference when it comes to prescription-quality fish oil and the kind found in over-the-counter supplements. January 19, 2016 [When It Comes to Supplements, What's Really in the Bottle?](https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/article/when-it-comes-to-supplements-whats-really-in-the-bottle/) When one hospital challenged supplements companies to prove their labels were accurate, the results were troubling -- especially for the hospital's tiniest patients. January 19, 2016 [Are Health Supplements Too Much of a Good Thing?](https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/frontline/article/are-health-supplements-too-much-of-a-good-thing/) You probably don't need to eat 83 bowls of cereal in one sitting. Compare the nutrients you get from daily supplements to what researchers say your body actually needs.
